stories.original_headline: Male bonobos use hidden clues to boost mating success
stories.original_summary: Male bonobos have an impressive ability to detect when females are most fertile, even though the usual visual cues are unreliable. stories.fantasy_headline: Forest Bonobos Uncover Secret Fertility Signs
stories.fantasy_story: Wise naturalists observed the nimble bonobos of the Great Congo Jungle. They discovered that male bonobos possess an uncanny ability to sense a female's most fertile time. These clever creatures interpret hidden signals, combining swelling patterns and past birthing records to find ideal mates.

stories.original_headline: Scientists finally uncovered why the Indus Valley Civilization collapsed
stories.original_summary: A series of century-scale droughts may have quietly reshaped one of the world’s earliest urban civilizations. stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Indus Kingdom Fell to Nature's Lingering Dry Spells
stories.fantasy_story: Grand scholars have finally deciphered the ancient scrolls of the Indus Kingdom. It seems a series of long, dry spells, lasting many decades, slowly weakened the mighty realm. As the magical rainfall dwindled, the people were forced to seek refuge along the great Indus River, until the kingdom faded away.

stories.fantasy_headline: The Bard Sudan Archives Charms Halls with Enchanted Fiddle Tunes
stories.fantasy_story: Tales speak of the magnificent bard, Sudan Archives, and her enchanted fiddle. Each new scroll of song reveals her mastery, as she shapes the fiddle's voice in wondrous ways. Her melodies fill the grand halls and taverns, captivating all who hear them with their unique magic and rhythm.
